metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11110 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ole_init function in ole.c in catdoc 0.95 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer underflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file, i.e., data is written to memory addresses before the beginning of the tmpBuf buffer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11110` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

catdoc - 0.94.4-1.1+deb8u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> reproducer in redhat bug report

criterions.comment: catdoc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.94.4-1.1+deb8u1build0.14.04.1').
